main event: A witness sighted a bright red light moving southeast from his position in Riverton, Illinois on April 1, 1966. The object then appeared to stop in mid-air and reverse direction, proceeding northwest until it gradually disappeared.
interesting points: The object flew southerly, appeared to stop in mid-air, and then reversed direction to proceed northwest.
The witness is described as very reliable and having excellent knowledge of helicopters, weather balloons, and aircraft in general.
Strong winds at the 1,000 ft level would have likely blown any sound emitted by an aircraft away from the observer.
Several light aircraft were reported in the area, but it was not possible to confirm if they were related to the sighting.
The lights on the object conformed to standard aircraft lighting in color and position.
result: Likely a light aircraft, but the exact nature of the object could not be determined conclusively.
